name: pungent
content:
Add to word list

smelling or tasting very strong and sharp: the pungent whiff of a goat I sat down to a cup of wonderfully pungent Turkish coffee. Synonyms
fetid formal
funky (BAD) US informal
malodorous formal
niffy UK informal
putrid (DECAYED)
rank (SMELL)
smelly
stinking informal
stinky informal
whiffy UK informalOpposites
fragrant
perfumed
scented
literary spoken or written in a way that has a strong effect: pungent criticism/commentary She is very good at writing pungent, funny dialogue.
More examplesFewer examplesThe air is full of the pungent odor of chicken houses and pig farms.You could wear thin, disposable gloves when you handle garlic, onion, fish, or other pungent foods. Fish sauce is salty and pungent.People love a pungent quotation, a witty maxim.Perhaps the most pungent and affecting comment came from a young African American woman: "I don't get why we're fighting for somebody else's freedom when we barely have our own."
